application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: TPO 7 - T131 - Atlantic Cedar to fell
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
The mature Cedar tree is situated in the front of the property. It is in good condition and is a standout tree of the area. The tree can be seen by neighbours as well as path and road users.

This tree is a standout tree of the area and to fell it would leave the amenity of the area in great deficit. The reports of subsidence have not been collaborated with evidence provided. The report of subsidence is valid but requires evidence to lower the area amenity by felling this tree.
The application is refused due to the lack of evidence provided. To allow a removal of a tree of this quality we will need evidence that it is the cause of subsidence.
